title: Soursop
summary: Soursop (also called graviola, guyabano, and in Hispanic America, guan√°bana) is the fruit of Annona muricata, a broadleaf, flowering, evergreen tree.[4][5] The exact origin is unknown; it is native to the tropical regions of the Americas and the Caribbean and is widely propagated.[6]  It is in the same genus, Annona, as cherimoya and is in the Annonaceae family.
